thread.title: Dengue count rises to 507 in city
thread.title_full: Dengue count rises to 507 in city

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Dengue count rises to 507 in city
text:
Tribune News Service
Chandigarh, October 17
As many as 507 city residents have been diagnosed with dengue at various laboratories, including the Department of Virology, PGIMER, the Department of Microbiology, GMCH-32, the GMSH-16 and the District Priority Lab at the Civil Hospital Mani Majra, till today. With the onset of dengue season, the malaria wing of the UT Health Department stepped up the enforcement and field activities for prevention and control of the disease. An emergency meeting of multipurpose health supervisors and multipurpose workers was held today to gear up the field operations. Besides, fogging was done in the NAC, the motor market and the Modern Housing Complex at Mani Majra. Meanwhile, the department issued three notices and 15 challans to violators in Dhanas, Sarangpur and the Sector 48 motor market where breeding of dengue larvae was found.
